definition:
**Definition:** Let $A=(a_{ij})$ be a square matrix of order $n$. The
matrix $A$ is *symmetric* if $a_{ij} = a_{ji}$ for all
$1 \leq i \leq n, 1 \leq j \leq n$.

$A =
\begin{pmatrix}
  a_{11} & \cdots & a_{1n} \\
  \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\
  a_{n1} & \cdots & a_{nn}
\end{pmatrix}$

**Properties:**

1.  $A^t = A$ where $A^t$ is the matrix transpose

**Examples:**

-   $\begin{pmatrix}
        a & b \\
        b & c 
      \end{pmatrix}$

-   $\begin{pmatrix}
        a & b & c \\
        b & d & e \\
        c & e & f 
      \end{pmatrix}$
